sn22.94:1.5: The Buddha rejects the metaphysical views of absolute, eternal existence and annihilation (SN 12.15:3.1, SN 12.48:2.2), but he asserts the reality of that which is conditioned and impermanent, namely the aggregates. The Buddha was neither a substantialist nor an idealist; he was a relational phenomenologist.
sn22.94:4.1: The Pali is loke lokadhammo. It seems useful to keep the overly-literal rendering “worldly phenomenon in the world” to maintain the pattern of the discourse. Here it alludes to the idea that it is the world because it “wears away” (SN 35.82:2.3).
